sentence.Network_en: Bureaucracy can entangle ventures for months.
sentence.Network_cn: 官僚体制会使风险投资搁置好几个月。

sentence.Network_en: His tactics were to entangle the opposition in a web of parliamentary procedure.
sentence.Network_cn: 他的策略是使反对派陷入错综复杂的议会程序之中。
不要让钓鱼线缠在一起.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 记忆英语单词方法 ... tangle 纠缠 entangle 使纠缠 untangle 解开.
GRE逆序_馆档网 ... wrangle 争论，激辩，吵架 entangle 使纠缠，卷入 wangle （用计谋等）得到，取得.
英语词汇的奥秘 ... enlink 把…连结起来 entangle 缠住，套住 engird 卷，缠.
英语构词法记忆单词研究 ... ensure 保证 entangle 使困惑,使陷入 enthrall 迷住.

list.abs: 高分子的链缠结(chain entanglement)是高分子凝聚态物理中基本问题。缠结如何进行定量化描述是高分子缠结研究中一个重要问题。高分子链只有通过相互穿插的方式形成“.

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English (formerly also as intangle): from en-, in- (as an intensifier) + tangle

entry.def: If one thing entangles itself with another, the two things become caught together very tightly.

example.ex: The blade of the oar had entangled itself with something in the water.
example.tran: 船桨的桨叶和水里的什么东西缠住了。

entry.tran: 使陷入，使卷入（问题、困难等）
entry.def: If something entangles you in problems or difficulties, it causes you to become involved in problems or difficulties from which it is hard to escape.

example.ex: Bureaucracy can entangle ventures for months...
example.tran: 官僚体制会使风险投资搁置好几个月。

example.ex: His tactics were to entangle the opposition in a web of parliamentary procedure.
example.tran: 他的策略是使反对派陷入错综复杂的议会程序之中。

sentences.sentence: "Our people should not be mired in the past"

means.word_mean: 2. twist together or entwine into a confusing mass;

auth_sentence.content: Lest she should entangle her Feet in her Petticoat.
auth_sentence.res_content: Lest she should entangle her Feet in her Petticoat.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Lest she should entangle her Feet in her Petticoat.

auth_sentence.content: Nets that entangle the...silken wings of a tender conscience.
auth_sentence.res_content: Nets that entangle the...silken wings of a tender conscience.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Nets that entangle the...silken wings of a tender conscience.

auth_sentence.content: Curious whales have been known to entangle themselves in boat moorings.
auth_sentence.res_content: Curious whales have been known to entangle themselves in boat moorings.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Curious whales have been known to entangle themselves in boat moorings.

means.word_mean: 使某人(某物/自己)缠绕,纠缠于(某物中);使某人(自己)陷入(困难或复杂的环境中)

sentences.en: Sara had got entangled with some political group.
sentences.cn: 萨拉与某一政治团体有牵连。

sentences.en: Some military observers fear the US could get entangled in another war.
sentences.cn: 一些军事观察家担心美国会卷入另一场战争。
